title: Update typography to calligraphic fonts with blue, red, and white color scheme

requirements.text: Update the global CSS typography in frontend/index.css to use calligraphic or script-style fonts for headings and decorative text elements throughout the application

quotes: Try more calligraphic fonts with blue red and white

acceptanceCriteria: Headings (h1, h2, h3) use calligraphic or script-style fonts
Body text remains readable with appropriate font pairing
Font choices are web-safe or properly imported from Google Fonts or similar service

requirements.text: Replace the current professional neutral color scheme in frontend/index.css CSS variables with a blue, red, and white color palette using OKLCH color format

quotes: Try more calligraphic fonts with blue red and white

acceptanceCriteria: Primary colors use shades of blue
Accent colors use shades of red
Background and neutral elements use white and light tones
Color variables maintain light and dark mode compatibility
All color definitions use OKLCH format consistent with existing implementation

requirements.text: Update all component styles across the application to reflect the new blue, red, and white color scheme, ensuring consistent visual theme on all pages (AboutPage, WritingPage, CharacterDevelopmentPage, PreviewPage, GrammarCheckPage, WritersBlockPage, ImageCreationPage, WritingPromptsPage, FlipbookPage)

quotes: Try more calligraphic fonts with blue red and white

acceptanceCriteria: All pages display the new color scheme consistently
Navigation and UI components use the updated colors
Text remains readable with sufficient contrast ratios
Interactive elements (buttons, links, inputs) use appropriate colors from the new palette

constraints: Do not modify the backend Motoko code
Maintain existing functionality while updating visual design
Preserve read-only paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui
nonGoals: Altering backend data models or API endpoints
